INktHookCallInfoPlugin Interface Reference

Exposes methods for accessing hooked function call information in custom-handler DLLs (inprocess). More...

import"DeviareCOM.idl";

Inherits IDispatch.

 Stores user-defined data that is maintained between pre and post call stages. Use ReadIntercallData to read this data. More...
 

Detailed Description

Exposes methods for accessing hooked function call information in custom-handler DLLs (inprocess).

Member Function Documentation

HRESULT INktHookCallInfoPlugin::Add ( [in] BSTR  name,
[in] VARIANT  value 
)

Add a custom parameter.

Parameters
nameThe name of the parameter to add.
valueThe VARIANT to add.
Returns
S_OK on success.
E_POINTER if value is NULL.
E_INVALIDARG if variant type is unsupported.
HRESULT INktHookCallInfoPlugin::AddByte ( [in] BSTR  name,
[in] unsigned char  value 
)

Add an unsigned byte to the custom parameters.

Parameters
nameThe name of the unsigned byte parameter to add.
valueThe value.
Returns
S_OK on success.
E_POINTER if value is NULL.
E_FAIL on general error.

S_OK on success.

get

Get the executed CPU clock-cycle count in the current thread.

Parameters
[in,out]pValPointer to unsigned 64-bit integer to receive clock cycle count.
Returns
S_OK on success.
E_POINTER if pVal is NULL.
E_FAIL on general error.
HRESULT INktHookCallInfoPlugin::CurrentProcess ( [out, retval] INktProcess **  ppProc)

Get the current process object.

Parameters
[in,out]ppProcA pointer to receive the process object interface.
Returns
S_OK or E_FAIL.

Returns
S_OK on success.
E_POINTER if pVal is NULL.
E_FAIL on general error.

HRESULT INktHookCallInfoPlugin::FilterSpyMgrEvent ( )

Prevent the current call from being sent to the SpyMgr session. Use it for filtering calls.

Returns
S_OK on success.

[in,out]pValIf non-null, the value.

HRESULT INktHookCallInfoPlugin::HookInfo ( [out, retval] INktHookInfo **  ppHookInfo)
get

Get the hook information associated with the call.

Parameters
[in,out]ppHookInfoPointer to address to receive the INktHookInfo interface.
Returns
S_OK on success.
E_POINTER if ppHook is NULL.
E_FAIL on general error.
HRESULT INktHookCallInfoPlugin::IsPreCall ( [out, retval] VARIANT_BOOL *  pVal)
get

Indicates if this is the pre-call stage of the hooked function.

Parameters
[in,out]pValPointer to receive boolean value.
Returns
S_OK on success, or E_FAIL on general error.
HRESULT INktHookCallInfoPlugin::KernelModeTimeMs ( [out, retval] double *  pVal)
get

Get the running time of the current thread in kernel mode in milliseconds.

Parameters
[in,out]pValPointer to double-precision floating point value to get millisecond count.
Returns
S_OK on success.
E_POINTER if pVal is NULL.
E_FAIL on general error.
HRESULT INktHookCallInfoPlugin::LastError ( [out, retval] LONG *  pVal)
get

Get the operating system last error code of the calling thread.

Parameters
[in,out]pValPointer to receive the error code.
Returns
S_OK on success.
E_POINTER if pVal is NULL.
E_FAIL on general error.
Remarks
* 0 (zero) indicates successful operation.
* To convert the error code to a readable string, check FormatMessage API function on MSDN.
* To convert a system error into an HRESULT value, use the HRESULT_FROM_WIN32 macro.
HRESULT INktHookCallInfoPlugin::LastError ( [in] LONG  newValue)
set

Set the operating system last error code of the calling thread.

Parameters
newValueThe new value.
Returns
S_OK on success, or E_FAIL on general error.
Remarks
* 0 (zero) indicates successful operation.
HRESULT INktHookCallInfoPlugin::Params ( [out, retval] INktParamsEnum **  ppParamsEnum)

Get the parameters of the call.

Parameters
[in,out]ppParamsEnumPointer to address to receive the parameter enumerator interface.
Returns
S_OK on success.
E_POINTER if ppParamsEnum is NULL.
E_FAIL on general error.
INktHookCallInfoPlugin::ReadIntercallData ( [in] my_ssize_t  destAddr,
[in] my_ssize_t  offset,
[in] my_ssize_t  bytes 
)

Retrieves user-defined data that is maintained between pre and post call stages. Use WriteIntercallData to store this data.

See also
WriteIntercallData
Parameters
destAddrPointer-sized variable indicating address to store retrieved data.
offsetOffset in the internal buffer to begin read.
bytesNumber of bytes to read.
Remarks
Number of bytes cannot exceed 128.
Returns
S_OK on success.
E_INVALIDARG if byte count and/or offset are invalid; or the requested byte count exceeds internal buffer size (128 bytes).
E_POINTER if destination address is NULL.
E_FAIL if general failure.
HRESULT INktHookCallInfoPlugin::Register ( [in] eNktRegister  asmReg,
[out, retval] my_ssize_t *  pVal 
)
get

Get a CPU register value.

Parameters
asmRegeNktRegister enumeration member representing the CPU register to retrieve.
[in,out]pValA pointer to a register-sized variable to receive the register value.
Returns
S_OK on success.
E_POINTER if pVal is NULL.
E_FAIL on general error.
HRESULT INktHookCallInfoPlugin::Register ( [in] eNktRegister  asmReg,
[in] my_ssize_t  newValue 
)
set

Set CPU register value.

Parameters
asmRegeNktRegister enumeration member representing the CPU register to modify.
newValueThe new register value.
Returns
S_OK on success.
E_FAIL on general error.
HRESULT INktHookCallInfoPlugin::Result ( [out, retval] INktParam **  ppParam)

Get the result of the call.

Parameters
[in,out]ppParamPointer to address to receive the INktParam parameter interface representing the result value.
Returns
S_OK on success.
E_POINTER if ppParam is NULL.
E_FAIL on general error.

Skip calling the original function.

Returns
S_OK on success.
E_FAIL on general error.

HRESULT INktHookCallInfoPlugin::UserModeTimeMs ( [out, retval] double *  pVal)

Get the running time of the current thread in user mode in milliseconds.

[in,out]pValPointer to double-precision floating point value to get millisecond count.

INktHookCallInfoPlugin::WriteIntercallData ( [in] my_ssize_t  destAddr,
[in] my_ssize_t  offset,
[in] my_ssize_t  bytes 
)

Stores user-defined data that is maintained between pre and post call stages. Use ReadIntercallData to read this data.

See also
ReadIntercallData
Parameters
destAddrPointer-sized variable indicating address containing data to store.
offsetOffset in the internal buffer to begin write.
bytesNumber of bytes to write.
Remarks
Number of bytes cannot exceed 128.
Returns
S_OK on success.
E_INVALIDARG if byte count and/or offset are invalid; or the requested byte count exceeds internal buffer size (128 bytes).
E_POINTER if source address is NULL.
E_FAIL if general failure.
